data.description:
Follow the story of Jake Higgins, a famous anthropologist, who is thrown deep into the emerald and impenetrable Amazonian rain forest - the green hell. What you discover there will be worse than what you have ever fought against to survive. Find yourself stranded in this  dangerous jungle, surrounded by predators with only a trusty smartwatch, backpack, and a survival guide to help you stay alive. 

Green Hell VR now also includes the Spirits of Amazonia Update - a prequel which presents the adventures of Jake set before the events of the original Green Hell. 
Your main goal will be to gain the trust of the Mu'agi tribe, along with the chief of the native Amazonian village. To accomplish this, you will need to complete missions relating to the local legends, to help out tribe members, and to provide supplies for the village, all rebuilt and tailored for the VR platform.

Highlights:
- The first part of a new prequel trilogy story set before the events of the original game
- 10-15 hours of new content - the in-game area is DOUBLED in comparison to the base game
- Brand new activities, such as  helping out the local population
- Discover new tribal villages and challenging Tribal Legends

changelog.change_log:
- Player cannot pick up a weapon from the backpack if the dominant hand is set to left - fixed
- Waraha warrior may become immortal after shooting him with a bow - fixed

- Hand stays as partially closed after putting back the backpack - Fixed
- SoA - Dirt and moss on legend stones looks better now
- Adjustments to level of details settings

Quest (1.5.4):

- Levels won't spawn the player correctly if they move their head during loading - Fixed
- Some languages not displaying correctly in specific instances during the Spirits of Amazonia storyline - Fixed
- Collisions of bamboo trees are still present despite cutting down the upper part of the tree - Fixed

Changelog 1.5.2:

- New sound effects to highlight important moments of  gameplay
- It's now possible to build a campfire in the Mu'agi village fireplace
- Lighting improvements in dream sequences
- Overall game stability has been improved
- Various  performance improvements - especially on SoA levels
- Visual upgrade to water reservoirs across the game
- Fixed a bug in which the Sort button in the backpack becomes blocked.
- Adjustments to player colliders across the Dream sequences
- Japanese texts in dialogues with Mu'agi display correctly now
- Bamboo trees can now be cut
- Copa Hongo that has been put in the dryer no longer breaks the progression of world time
- Players cannot walk on the bottom of one particular lake anymore
- Legends stones that have been read are now properly grayed out on the map in the notebook after loading a save file
- Fixed a bug where players could become stuck on a black screen after finishing the SoA Dream sequence for the second time
- The "Vegan!" achievement now has a more precise description

Changelog Hotfix 1.5.1: 
- Some players stay immortal even after SoA tutorial - fixed
- Game states, that player needs to finish the tutorial to leave the main village in SoA even after finishing it - fixed, as well as for already affected savefiles.
- Adjustments to lighting in Dream sequences in main Story mode.

- Small general improvements to performance
- Adjustments to food values and their preparation times
- Visual adjustments in dream sequences
- Insomnia fixes - time required for first level does not reset after loading a save. Insomnia levels one by one, but time required for higher levels was reduced
- Player's forearm isn't tilted anymore after rotating wrist, making it easier to use smartwatch
- Adjustments to balance of tools - obsidian tools are more durable now
- Adjustments to audio volume
- Caves and buildings no longer cut off environmental audio
- Long subtitles wrap and should now be displayed more on the center of view
- Improvements made to the interaction threshold of menu buttons
- Scaling UI now affects all HUD elements

FIXES 
- Oculus firmware issue - Some players cannot continue the game after one time optimization process.

FIXES
- Some players get an app crash on 11% of one time optimization process

NEW
- Notepad improvement - List of effects of consumed herbs should be easier to understand.
- New physical interaction - Ripping or cutting off lines from the trees.
- New comfort setting - Grab Toggle - players can now pick up and hold the item with a single press of the grab button.
- Players can throw axes, machetes, and other sharp tools with throw assist (press the trigger while holding an item). Thrown tools and weapons will hammer into the trees.

ADJUSTMENTS
- Performance is better now.
- Lighting on maps is more natural.
- UI on shelter hut and structures you can save is more intuitive now.
- Bow should be more pleasant to use.
- Holding a tribal bow looks better now.
- Hand UI in the dream sequences now smoothly appears.
- Better dialogue system, players can find new pieces of dialogue.
- Palms have more precise collisions.
- Adjustments to the blueprints unlock system.
- In Challenge mode - Players can see in the pause menu, how much time is left.
- Coconuts won't fall from the palms by themselves so frequently.
- Hanging coconuts is more visible now.
- Fishes respawn less frequently. 
- Players can now use throw assist (trigger while holding an item) to throw small stones.

FIXES
- Sound of Jake's heavy breathing won't clip if the stamina starts regenerating.
- Some wrong description in the notepad has been fixed.
- Tribal Spear looks better now.
- Unmounting a shooted arrow shouldn't generate any problems now.
- The Backpack UI of medicine won't have a red outline anymore.
- Translation issues have been fixed.
- Players should always be able to see the time when the save was made.
- Bamboo trunk now drops a bamboo log when cut down.
- Rain effect on the water surface won't be visible if it's under some sort of roofing.
- Challenge rankings should show rank properly if the player's not in the top 10.
- Banisteriopsis vine fits tight now.
- Page in the first village can be picked up after the player reloads the game.

## **NEW**
- New game mode - Challenge Mode with its Leaderboards
- Better hand tracking and hands physics
- Dirtiness can be visible on the HUD
- New entries in the Player's notebook

## **FIXES**
- minor bugs with walkie-talkie and dialogue system - fixed
- bugs with bow and its string - fixed
- bandages can stop working under some conditions - fixed
- Dialogues sometimes was available in the wrong points of the story - fixed
- Music in the ending scenes sometimes doesn't start correctly - fixed
- Caiman's Sound Effects sometimes don't play - fixed
- Copa Hongu disappears when put in the bowl - fixed
- some building Sketches in the Notebook show the wrong versions of it (bamboo vs. wood) - fixed
- few minor mistakes in the notebook - fixed
- Note about tobacco glows before you can pick it up (tutorial) - fixed
- few minor spelling mistakes - fixed
- Crafting when the backpack is open will change the backpack tab - fixed
- Few holes in the map in various places - fixed
- Pause Menu doesn't cut out all sounds - fixed

## **ADJUSTMENTS**
- Better hand tracking - hands are now more stable during movement
- better collision on the ground and tree roots
- adding firewood to the bonfire is easier now
- Caiman is now smaller, and his hitboxes are more precise
- Nights have periods where it's not as dark as before
- Dirtiness on the skin is more visible now
- You won't meet crabs in the Gold Mine anymore
- Leeches grow over time - the longer you'll have one, the larger it will become
- Jake will learn new blueprints with every Dream sequence (in story mode)
- More diverse spawn points of the arachnids
- You can grab a coconut with both hands now

... and many many more smaller changes :)

- Player can not save sometimes - fixed
- Caiman bones and meat do not save properly - fixed
- Items in the bowl do not save properly - fixed
- Additional fixes to save system

FIXES:
- parrots have improved landing spots on Wetlands
- many terrain holes has been filled
- fixes for the player indicator on the map
- Fixes for markers on the map
- Now the time format should work as intented even when sleeping
- Gasoline will no longer be able to extinguish fires.

ADJUSTMENTS
-  Wet hands got an improved shader
- The position of the audiolog button has been adjusted to a more comfortable spot
- Changed animation while holding Tribal Bow
- Refurbishment of the backpack system
   - Touch support for the backpack tabs
   - Materials can stack
   - Arrows now have a dedicated spot

NEW
- Achievements - both on the Meta Quest but also in the game itself in the notebook
- option to scale the UI to your liking

**Hotfix (1.1.1)**
- New art on the startup of the game
- Distortions of the disabled HUD has been fixed.

**FIXES in 1.1.0**
- Finishing the ghost of a building now destroys bushes that grow around it
- The Blood Vial in the story mode can now be taken out of the backpack
- Crafting near the saving point no longer triggers the save menu
- Save made after putting the Blood Vial into the analyzer in WHA tent will have it after loading it
- Many players have reported that the second map was missing for them so now the second map piece can be found again in the Airport
- Hiding a loaded bow in the lost on your shoulder slot won’t make it harder to use after pick up.
- Some more logs have been added to the Wetlands area to make it easier to walk around.
- You can gather water and cook in the white pot
- Dropped cooked meat doesn’t look raw anymore
- Discus Fish body is visible now
- Minor fixes to backpack UI
- Killed hostile animals won’t respawn immediately after loading the save
- An overweight backpack won’t slow us down in the Dream sequences anymore
- Small Leaf Pile can now dry out to become the Dry Leaf to be be used as kindling
- Some dialogue issues have been fixed
- Jaguars and other predators won't be chasing you forever anymore.
- Death cause on the death screen is more accurate now
- Many LOD issues have been fixed

**ADJUSTMENTS in 1.1.0**
- Collision of the terrain is more precise to make teleport movement a bit easier
- Story Items (the most important ones) are more visible now
- There was a chance to spawn near the Black Caiman in survival mode which isn’t fair. Thus, this spawn point has been adjusted.
- Small animals are easier to kill by throwing heavy items at them
- Pouring the water looks better now
- GPS on the smartwatch refreshes more frequently now

**NEW in 1.1.0**
- You can check items' descriptions while holding them, to learn if there is any hazard to getting parasites while eating with dirty hands
- Throwing mode - while holding something you want to throw, press Trigger on the holding hand. Then aim with the other hand and perform a throwing motion (release a grab button at the end)
- Custom difficulty added - players can adjust the difficulty of the game in many ways. For example, players that suffer from arachnophobia can turn off spiders.
- Burning torch deals fire damage now
- Players can find new saving points on “Welcome in the jungle” (and lower) difficulty.
- Immersive mode. You can choose which HUD elements you want to see - you can disable it for maximum immersion!
- Sort button in the backpack - helps organize stuff
- Body of some small animals have physics now (ragdoll)
- Water - items dropped in the water generate sound effects and splashes.
- You can adjust the position of holsters, walkie-talkie and notepad to better match different heights of players
... and many many more smaller changes :slightly_smiling_face:

FIXES
- Jake doesn't complain about hunger and thirstiness way as often as he used to
- Crafting sometimes stopped working at all
- Player sometimes couldn't make a fire, because rain was still raining and it was invisible and soundless
- Entering the Pause menu during dying or fainting/using the Pause menu in certain events could have generated an eternal black screen
- Sometimes players couldn't pick up arrows from the quiver
- After loading a save file with a bow stored in the backpack made this particular bow oddly heavy
- Spears sometimes unintentionally collided with the environment

- Better quality beds had no effect for the Sanity level
- There were instances of overlapping narration in the cutscene after the tutorial

ADJUSTMENTS

- Some icons in the notebook were non-intuitive

- Level of Detail of many items has been changed
- Balance of Weapons Damage has been revisited and changed accordingly (also, Spear damage while using it as a bat has been adjusted)
- Turning while aiming with teleport has been adjusted - now you have to tilt your thumbstick forward, and after that, you can choose your orientation after the teleport.

NEW
- Autosave now has a separate slot to not overwrite the selected main save
- Foliage in the jungle is now moving on the wind
- Player now has feedback about changes to his Sanity Level generated by leeches
- New environment sounds in the Goldmine
- Sound effects for opening and closing bidon
